data.event: Bagdad, Tamaulipas, Mexico was a town established in 1848 on the south bank of the mouth of the RÃ­o Grande.
Officially declared non-existent in 1880, it is now invisible, covered by the shifting sands of time.
A major player in the American Civil War, today few realize it even existed, nor its vital importance to the Confederacy in its struggle against the North.

event.title: entitled "Map of the Country Adjacent to the Left Bank of the Rio Grande Below Matamoros, 1847

data.event: One of the first appearances of Bagdad was on a map entitled "Map of the Country Adjacent to the Left Bank of the Rio Grande Below Matamoros, 1847."
